perturbation.original_text: 9) Governing Law This Agreement is entered into in the State of Texas and shall be interpreted according to the laws of the State of Texas.
perturbation.changed_text: 5) Confidentiality "Confidential information" shall mean any and all technical and non-technical information, documents and materials related to client projects of party and products, services and business of each of the parties. COMPANY and Bravatek agree to maintain in strict confidence and not to disclose or disseminate, or to use for any purposes other than performance of the projects, the Confidential Information disclosed. The obligation of non-disclosure shall not apply to the following: a. Information at or after such time that is publicly available through no fault of either party b. Information at or after such time that is disclosed to either party by a third party entitled to disclose such information c. Information which is required by law to be disclosed to federal, state or local authorities. 9) Governing Law This Agreement is entered into in the State of Texas and shall be interpreted according to the laws of the State of Nevada.
perturbation.explanation: The agreement states that it is entered into in Texas and shall be interpreted according to the laws of the State of Texas. The modification moves the governing law to under the confidentiality section, and changes the state to Nevada. This could cause the contract to be interpreted according to Nevada state law and not Texas state law as initially expected.
perturbation.law_explanation: Texas Business and Commerce Code allows parties to choose which jurisdiction's laws govern their agreement. By changing the governing law section to a place where it is less discoverable, and by changing the state to Nevada, the parties' intent regarding governing law becomes unclear, potentially contradicting the principle that agreements should reflect the parties' intentions and creating ambiguity that could be challenged in court.

perturbation.original_text: 4) Compensation When custom Products are designed, developed and to be delivered to Bravatek-identified perspective clients, the parties shall agree to a proposed sales price for use during the project in writing prior to the commencement of each project. 2 For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek registered with COMPANY via email to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-designated distribution affiliate(s) or sales channel(s), Bravatek will receive a lead-finder fee, to be mutually discussed and finally decided by COMPANY at the range of minimum of 10% to maximum of 20% of project revenue, with an exact fee to be depending upon the overall project sales margin and cost of development and delivery of each project, payable NET 30 days after each client payment on delivered products received at COMPANY's bank account.
perturbation.changed_text: 11) Modifications No changes or modifications of this Agreement or any of its terms shall be deemed effective unless in writing and executed by the parties hereto. 4) Compensation When custom Products are designed, developed and to be delivered to Bravatek-identified perspective clients, the parties shall agree to a proposed sales price for use during the project in writing prior to the commencement of each project. 2 For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek registered with COMPANY via email to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-designated distribution affiliate(s) or sales channel(s), Bravatek will receive a lead-finder fee, to be mutually discussed and finally decided by COMPANY at the range of minimum of 10% to maximum of 20% of project revenue, with an exact fee to be depending upon the overall project sales margin and cost of development and delivery of each project, payable NET 30 days after each client payment on delivered products received at COMPANY's bank account.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the Compensation clause to follow the Modifications clause makes it more likely that it can be overlooked, especially since compensation and modifications are not usually related. This could result in Bravatek not receiving the lead-finder fee, especially since the text also contains the verbiage "to be mutually discussed and finally decided by COMPANY".
perturbation.law_explanation: This code covers the formation of contracts. The relocation and subsequent overlooking of the compensation clause will give the company more power than Bravatek. This will make the compensation clause unenforceable, which contradicts this code.

perturbation.original_text: 10) Indemnification COMPANY shall indemnify Bravatek, its directors, officers and employees, for any and all damages, costs, expenses, and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney's fees and court costs incurred in connection with any third-party claim, action or proceeding arising from the negligence or intentional misconduct of COMPANY or breach of COMPANY of any of its obligations under this Agreement. Bravatek shall indemnify COMPANY, its directors, officers and employees, for any and all damages, costs, expenses, and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney's fees and court costs, incurred in connection with any third-party claim, action or proceeding arising from the negligence or intentional misconduct of Bravatek or breach of Bravatek of any of its obligations under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 2) Duties of COMPANY COMPANY agrees to use its best efforts to promote and support project lead finding and after-sales support of Bravatek by: a. Listing Bravatek in all appropriate sales and marketing materials as a non-exclusive alliance partner (with focus of government customers) b. Provide timely responses to both technical and administrative questions posed by Bravatek. c. Promote Bravatek's product and service offerings whenever possible. d. Aid Bravatek in the writing of any technical/marketing/sales documents when requested and participate in mutually-agreed upon sales calls. e. Provide Bravatek with co-branded marketing material that can be emailed or handed to prospective clients. 10) Indemnification COMPANY shall indemnify Bravatek, its directors, officers and employees, for any and all damages, costs, expenses, and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney's fees and court costs incurred in connection with any third-party claim, action or proceeding arising from the negligence or intentional misconduct of COMPANY or breach of COMPANY of any of its obligations under this Agreement. Bravatek shall indemnify COMPANY, its directors, officers and employees, for any and all damages, costs, expenses, and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney's fees and court costs, incurred in connection with any third-party claim, action or proceeding arising from the negligence or intentional misconduct of Bravatek or breach of Bravatek of any of its obligations under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the indemnification clause to follow the duties of the company puts it into a section where one party might not expect it to be. Indemnification clauses are meant to protect both parties, and this move makes it harder to find for Bravatek.
perturbation.law_explanation: This section discusses the statute of limitations in Texas. Making the indemnification clause harder to find will make it more difficult for the party to be indemnified to find out when their time period to seek indemnification began, which could limit their legal recourse.
